item.title: Reuters reveals Argentina central bank pauses rate hikes after inflation undershoot
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported Argentina’s central bank board was set to keep the benchmark interest rate steady at 75% as September […]

The post Reuters reveals Argentina central bank pauses rate hikes after inflation undershoot appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported Argentina’s central bank board was set to keep the benchmark interest rate steady at 75% as September inflation data came in lower than expected. The bank confirmed the news on Tuesday. The decision to hold the rate unchanged breaks one of the world’s most aggressive tightening cycles in the inflation-hit South American country where prices are set to rise around 100% this year.

The post Reuters reveals Argentina central bank pauses rate hikes after inflation undershoot appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals U.S. judge approves sales process for shares in Citgo Petroleum’s parent company
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report that a U.S. judge approved an auction process that could lead to the breakup of […]

The post Reuters reveals U.S. judge approves sales process for shares in Citgo Petroleum’s parent company appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report that a U.S. judge approved an auction process that could lead to the breakup of Venezuela owned Citgo Petroleum, the seventh-largest  U.S. oil refiner. Two years after first authorizing a sale of shares in Citgo’s parent company, PDVSA, the judge set bidding procedures and a calendar that could see a high bid accept within nine months to satisfy a $970 million judgment won by a Canadian miner over the expropriation of its assets in Venezuela. Reuters also revealed four other companies with $4.3 billion in combined claims against Venezuela — ConocoPhillips, Koch-related mineral and nitrogen companies, Gold Reserve Inc. and U.S. holders of defaulted Venezuelan bonds —  were seeking to have their own judgments registered with the same court. 

The post Reuters reveals U.S. judge approves sales process for shares in Citgo Petroleum’s parent company appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals largest Latin American development bank, IDB, ousts its president
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported major developments in a process that saw the largest Latin American development bank, IDB, oust its president, […]

The post Reuters reveals largest Latin American development bank, IDB, ousts its president appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported major developments in a process that saw the largest Latin American development bank, IDB, oust its president, Mauricio Claver-Carone, after an independent ethics probe found “direct evidence” that he had an intimate relationship with a subordinate and violated other bank rules. Reuters first broke news of the investigation in April this year and also revealed the probe’s findings and the bank votes to remove Claver-Carone

The post Reuters reveals largest Latin American development bank, IDB, ousts its president appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Mexico state utility bought coal from uninspected mines, including fatal site
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively revealed Mexico’s state-owned power utility has been buying coal from new mines that have not yet been visited […]

The post Reuters reveals Mexico state utility bought coal from uninspected mines, including fatal site appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively revealed Mexico’s state-owned power utility has been buying coal from new mines that have not yet been visited by labor inspectors, according to a Reuters analysis of coal contracts and inspection records, including the mine where 10 people died last month after flooding trapped them below ground.

The post Reuters reveals Mexico state utility bought coal from uninspected mines, including fatal site appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Mexico budget sees stronger growth, lower inflation in 2023
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report Mexican economic growth should accelerate in 2023 to around 3.0% from some 2.4% this year […]

The post Reuters reveals Mexico budget sees stronger growth, lower inflation in 2023 appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report Mexican economic growth should accelerate in 2023 to around 3.0% from some 2.4% this year as inflation cools markedly and oil output picks up, according to finance ministry draft budget forecasts seen by Reuters. Mexico’s economy has performed better than some analysts had previously expected in 2022, powered by strong demand for its goods in the United States, the country’s top trade partner.

The post Reuters reveals Mexico budget sees stronger growth, lower inflation in 2023 appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Pemex fined for failures at top oil field leading to flaring, faces another fine
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively revealed that Mexico’s hydrocarbon regulator has fined state oil company Pemex for development violations at one of its […]

The post Reuters reveals Pemex fined for failures at top oil field leading to flaring, faces another fine appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively revealed that Mexico’s hydrocarbon regulator has fined state oil company Pemex for development violations at one of its most important fields that has led to excessive flaring of natural gas and is preparing another fine for a similar field. Pressure is mounting on Pemex to clean up its operations, but alleged failures at the two fields, both considered strategic priorities, have resulted in huge amounts of gas being burnt off or wasted despite a global push to reduce emissions. 

The post Reuters reveals Pemex fined for failures at top oil field leading to flaring, faces another fine appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
